availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James P. Hendrick (Fleming Co. minister, chaplain 10th Ky Cav.)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, minister and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sophia Hendrick. Father of William Hendrick, Minnie Hendrick, Elizabeth Hendrick, and Penelope Hendrick. Graduate of Centre College in 1849. Presbyterian minister in Fleming County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 10th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry as chaplain from September 10, 1862, to September 17, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 794.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Flemingsburg, p. 396B.
U.S., School Catalogs, 1765-1935, Kentucky, Centre College 1860, American Antiquarian Society, Worcester, Massachusetts p. 21 of 49 on microfilm, (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 250.
Find A Grave, "James P. Hendrick (1828-1898)," Memorial #125807230 , http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/125807230 (accessed November 6, 2020).
